description.narrative: The project will provide technical assistance to build the capacity for effective agency/district level governance , provide technical assistance to policy-making at the federal, provincial and agency level.

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

1.1: Scale Item 4 2.1 : Scale 3 2.2: 702 VC/NCs, 25 tehsils in 7 districts and 6 sub-divisions 2.3 : 10 % 3.3 : 3( Number of issues identified through research, community and government engagement and resolved at the local level. ) 3.4: 8 ( Special Emphasis Programmes (SEPs) designed and implemented )

1.1. Scale 3 - details below) AIP projects implemented by the Government of KP were appraised with UNDP support on a demand-driven basis, approximately 25 PC-1s. UNDP supported 15 new Planning Officers who were onboarded to support P&D, and trained them on enhanced project appraisal methods for the provincial development portfolio. UNDP trained 115 officials on results-based planning frameworks, called PAMframes, and provided technical assistance to 24 government line departments in the development of sector plans. UNDP also worked with the Planning & Development Department and M&E Directorate to incorporate these planning frameworks in the provincial planning and monitoring and evaluation cycle and support data-driven development. UNDP worked closely with the Planning & Development Department and line departments on the design of high-impact pilot interventions called Special Emphasis Programmes (SEPs), aiming to drive transformative results in sectors that are critical to development in the Merged Areas. 1.2- Extent to which financial accounting and auditing systems are in place in merged areas. Target = No Target (Achieved in 2020) 1.3- Extent to which Governance institutions are strengthened to extend their presence in the merged areas Scale 1 = No capacity Scale 2= human resources exists and problems driven plan are being designed Scale 3= Human resources integrated and need based plans have been developed and staff has been trained to provide support for reforms implementation. Target 1.3: No Target (Scale 3 Already achieved in 2020) 2.1. All 25 TMAs and 7 ADLGs were supported for civil registration services, improved municipal services delivery, trade registrations and COVID awareness/prevention. 2.2. In process. Consultant firm has been hired and work initiated on the plans. 2.3. DROPPED due to indefinite delay in LG elections 3.1. Target: Achieved in 2020 3.2. (Already reached in 2020)= 3.3. Achieved 2 issues relating to land and mining were analyzed. 3.4: 8 SEPs approved by the government. These SEPs include initiatives on improving school enrollment, saving infant and maternal lives, strengthening service delivery, encouraging skills development, advancing women’s entrepreneurship, and a COVID-WASH campaign for sustainable adherence to COVID-19 preventive SOPs.

1.1 Extent to which administrative structures are aligned to integrate human resource systems for improved service delivery Scale Description: Scale 1 = No structures exist Scale 2 = some structures are aligned to integrate human resource systems, Scale 3= Most of the structures are aligned to integrate human resource system, problem driven development plans exist and diagnostic studies around issues are conducted Scale 4= All administrative structures are aligned to integrate human resource systems, Administrative structures have clear reporting lines and structures and and confidence building dialogue sessions are held between District level and Provincial stakeholders.
